ACTION STATEMENT: Build on the experience of the national  dialogues, held in 2021 as part of  Irelands preparations for the UN Food  Systems Summit, by continuing the  culture of dialogue and stakeholder  engagement, which is an important  component of a food systems  approach.
stakeholders: Department of Agriculture, Food and the Marine 004

MISSION STATEMENT: A Climate Smart,  Environmentally  Sustainable   Agri-Food Sector
GOAL STATEMENT: Develop a Climate Neutral Agri- Food System so that by 2050, the Climate Impact of Methane is Reduced to Zero and Remaining Agricultural Emissions are Balanced by Removals; and Improve Air Quality
stakeholders: Department of Agriculture, Food and the Marine 004

GOAL STATEMENT: Develop a Climate Neutral Agri- Food System so that by 2050, the Climate Impact of Methane is Reduced to Zero and Remaining Agricultural Emissions are Balanced by Removals; and Improve Air Quality
ACTION STATEMENT: Produce detailed plans by Q2 2022 to  manage the sustainable environmental  footprint of the dairy and the beef  sectors.

ACTION STATEMENT: Update Ag Climatise, as required, to  ensure consistency with new targets  agreed nationally and internationally  for the agri-food sector.

GOAL STATEMENT: Develop a Climate Neutral Agri- Food System so that by 2050, the Climate Impact of Methane is Reduced to Zero and Remaining Agricultural Emissions are Balanced by Removals; and Improve Air Quality
ACTION STATEMENT: The food and beverage industry will  continue to drive down GHG emissions  and develop zero waste approaches.

MISSION STATEMENT: A Climate Smart,  Environmentally  Sustainable   Agri-Food Sector
ACTION STATEMENT: Ensure that farms and forests do not  contribute to habitat destruction and  isolation, and also protect features  of cultural heritage and traditional  landscapes.
stakeholders: Department of Agriculture, Food and the Marine 004

MISSION STATEMENT: A Climate Smart,  Environmentally  Sustainable   Agri-Food Sector
GOAL STATEMENT: Protect High Status Sites and Contribute to the Protection and Restoration of Good Water Quality and Healthy Aquatic Ecosystems, as set out in the Water Framework Directive
ACTION STATEMENT: Launch a National Soil Sampling and  Analysis Programme to develop a  baseline of information in relation  to nutrient cycling and carbon  sequestration functions in soils and  develop a National Soils Strategy that  will assess all appropriate soil health  parameters and will inform future  policies on good soil management  practices, including at a regional level.
stakeholders: Department of Agriculture, Food and the Marine 004

MISSION STATEMENT: A Climate Smart,  Environmentally  Sustainable   Agri-Food Sector
GOAL STATEMENT: Embed the Agri-Food Sector in the Circular, Regenerative Bioeconomy
ACTION STATEMENT: Develop new bio-based value chains  based on Ireland’s comparative advantage  in the production of grass, legumes and  other perennial species.
